question.Q: The sign in the picture is _______.
A warning sign is designed to warn
question.A: The vehicles and pedestrians to be careful at a dangerous place
question.B: The vehicles and pedestrians not to pass
question.C: The driver there is a curve ahead
question.D: The driver there is a congestion-prone section ahead

question.Q: The sign in the picture is _______.
A directional sign is designed to
question.A: Warn the vehicles and pedestrians to be careful about a dangerous place
question.B: Prohibit or restrict the vehicles and pedestrians from passing
question.C: Indicate the vehicles and pedestrians to go ahead
question.D: Give information about road direction, place and distance

question.Q: The sign in the picture is _______.
A prohibitive sign is designed to
question.A: Warn the vehicles and pedestrians to be careful about a dangerous place
question.B: Give information about road direction, place and distance
question.C: Indicate the vehicles and pedestrians to go ahead
question.D: Prohibit or restrict the vehicles and pedestrians from passing

question.Q: The sign in the picture is _______.
An indicative sign is designed to indicate the vehicles and pedestrians to
question.A: Be careful about a dangerous place
question.B: Go ahead according to the line and direction indicated by the sign
question.D: Go ahead either in the direction or not in the direction indicated

question.Q: The sign in the picture is _______.

question.Q: The sign in the picture means ________.
The sign in the picture means ________.

question.A: Prohibited from turning left or right
question.C: Prohibited from making U turns from either side

question.Q: The sign in the picture means all vehicles are allowed only to ______.
The sign in the picture means all vehicles are allowed only to ______.
The sign in the picture allows _______ only.

question.B: The one-way passing of small buses

question.D: Go around on the right side

question.Q: The sign in the picture means this lane is for _____.
question.A: Both going straight and turning right

question.Q: The sign in the picture means _____ for motorized vehicles going into the road ahead.
question.C: The minimum speed limit is lifted

question.Q: The sign in the picture means this place is ______.
The sign in the picture means _______ when a motorized vehicle reaches this sign.
question.B: The no honk ban is lifted

question.Q: The sign in the picture means this lane is only for ______

question.A: A demarcation line for road management

question.A: A demarcation line for road management

question.Q: The sign in the picture means _______.

question.B: A road widening on the right side

The picture is a sign for a T-shaped intersection.

The picture is a sign for a slippery road.
The picture is a sign for an unmanned level crossing.
The picture is a village sign.
The picture is a sign for tunnel opening.
The picture is a sign for level crossing 100m ahead.
The picture is a sign for level crossing 100m ahead.
The picture is a slowdown sign.

The picture is a sign for Right bypassing.
The picture is a sign for no passing.
The picture is a sign for no passing.
The picture is a sign for no entry to motorized vehicles.
The picture is a sign for no overtaking.

The picture is a sign for limited weight.
The picture is a stop-for-inspection sign.

The picture is a sign for no left turn.
The picture is a sign for left and Right turns.

The picture is a sign prohibiting temporary vehicle stopping.
The picture is a sign prohibiting long stopping by vehicles.
The picture is a sign prohibiting U turn.
The picture is a sign for going by the Right road.
The picture is a one-way sign.
The picture is a sign for going first when crossing each other.
The picture is a sign for yielding to traffic on the branch road.
The picture is a sign for small bus lane.
The picture is a sign for watching out for pedestrians.
The picture is a sign for going straight and turning Right at an interchange.
The picture is a sign for going straight and turning left at an interchange.

The picture is a one-way sign.
The picture is a Right-turn sign.

The picture is a sign for an accident-prone section.
The picture is a direction and place sign.
The picture is a sign for expressway entry ahead.
The picture is a sign for expressway beginning.
The picture is a sign for expressway exit ahead.
The picture is a sign for passing from both sides.
A three-dimensional mark is designed to remind the drivers there is a structure above the road surface in the carriageway or nearby and they should avoid collision.
When the main sign is unable to completely indicate the regulations, an auxiliary sign should be set.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the time ranges specified in the main sign.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the type of the vehicles specified in the main sign.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the section 200m ahead specified in the main sign.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the section within 100m on the left side specified in the main sign.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the sections beyond 50m on both sides specified in the main sign.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the section 100m ahead specified in the main sign.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the area specified in the main sign.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the reasons for warning or prohibition.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the road 300m ahead is closed.
The sign in the picture is designed to indicate the vehicles should turn Right.
Traffic markings are divided into ______ according to functions.
The white marking in the picture is ________.
The double yellow solid lines in the picture are ________.
The double yellow central solid lines in the picture are _______.
The lane-dividing line in the picture is used to separate _______.
question.A: The vehicles running in the same direction
question.B: The vehicles running in the opposite directions
question.C: The motorized vehicles, the non-motorized vehicles and the pedestrians
question.D: The motorized vehicles and the non-motorized vehicles

question.Q: The crosswalk in the picture is a marking for the pedestrians to cross _______.
The yellow marking in the picture is _________.
question.A: The border line of a carriageway
question.C: The central line of a two-way, double lane road

question.Q: The yellow marking in the picture is _________.
question.A: The border line of a carriageway
question.C: The central line of a two-way, double lane road

question.Q: The yellow markings in the picture are designed to _________.
question.A: Divide the carriageways in the same direction
question.B: Indicate the border of a road
question.C: Allow the vehicles to cross the line for overtaking
question.D: Prohibit the vehicles from crossing the line for overtaking or rolling on the line

question.Q: The white solid line vertical to the road side in the picture is _________.
question.D: A marking for a prohibitive area

question.Q: The white diamond-shaped markings in the picture are _______.
question.D: A marking for a prohibitive area

question.Q: The bay-stopping marking in the picture is _________ for trolleys and motor vehicles (long-distance buses).
question.B: A pull-over, slowdown and yield section
question.C: A separating guide lane and a stopping area
question.D: A section for no overtaking or yielding

question.Q: The areas in the white broken lines at an intersection in the picture are _________.
The white parallel solid lines (zebra lines) vertical to the road side in the picture are markings for _______.
question.A: Ascertaining the distance between the vehicles on the expressway

question.Q: The speed limit signs in the picture indicate _________.
question.A: The average speed standards for motorized vehicles
question.B: The motorized vehicles should not run slower than the speeds specified in the markings
question.C: The motorized vehicles should not run faster than the speeds specified in the markings

question.Q: The markings in the picture are _____, with the solid line prohibiting vehicles from crossing the line to overtake or turning left.
question.A: The central line of a road
question.D: The central yellow broken and solid lines

question.Q: The marking in the picture ___________.
question.A: Prohibits vehicles from stopping at the road side for a long time
question.B: Prohibits vehicles from stopping at the road side temporarily
question.C: Prohibits vehicles from stopping at the road side for a long time or temporarily
question.D: Allows vehicles to stop at the road side for a long time or temporarily

question.Q: The marking in the picture ___________.
question.A: Prohibits vehicles from stopping at the road side temporarily
question.B: Prohibits vehicles from stopping at the road side for a long time or temporarily
question.C: Prohibits vehicles from stopping at the road side for a long time
question.D: Allows vehicles to stop at the road side for a long time or temporarily

question.Q: The marking in the picture ___________.
The white double solid lines in the picture are a marking for _________
The white double broken lines in the picture are a marking for ______.
The picture is ____.
question.B: A simplified cross-hatched area for no temporary stopping
question.C: A marking for no U turn

question.Q: The pictures are markings for ____.
The central yellow broken and solid lines in the picture mean ______.
question.A: The broken line prohibits vehicles from crossing and overtaking
question.B: The solid line allows vehicles to turn left
question.C: The solid line prohibits vehicles from crossing to overtake or turning left
question.D: The broken line prohibits vehicles from turning left

question.Q: The central yellow broken and solid lines in the picture means _________.
question.A: The broken line prohibits vehicles from turning left
question.B: The solid line allows vehicles to turn left
question.C: The solid line allows vehicles to cross for overtaking
question.D: The broken line allows vehicles to cross for overtaking or to turn left

question.Q: The yellow marking at the center of an intersection in the picture is _______.
question.B: A marking prohibiting non-motorized vehicles from passing

question.Q: The zebra marking in the picture is _________.
question.D: A waiting area for non-motorized vehicles

question.Q: The road sign in the picture is __________.
The yellow central broken line on a two-way road is used to separate the traffic flow in the same direction.
The white lane-dividing line in the picture is used to separate the traffic flow in opposite directions.
The white solid lines in the picture are lane borderlines used to indicate the borders of the lanes for motorized vehicles.
The areas within the white markings in the picture are the areas for vehicle parking.
The areas within the white markings in the picture are the areas for no vehicle parking
The white left-turn guide broken line in the picture means the left-turning vehicles should drive on the Right side of the guide line.
The guide arrows on the road in the picture indicate the directions in which the vehicles should drive.

The central yellow broken and solid lines in the picture indicate that the solid line prohibits vehicles from crossing to overtake or turning left and the broken line also prohibits vehicles from crossing to overtake or turning left.

The central circle in the picture is used to distinguish between the sharp and gentle turns of the vehicles and guide the left and Right turns of the vehicles at the intersection. The vehicles are not allowed to roll over the marking.

The yellow cross-hatched marking at the center of the intersection in the picture is used to indicate to the drivers that no temporary stopping is allowed in this area in order to prevent traffic congestion

The yellow marking at the center of the intersection in the picture is an area prohibiting the passing of non-motorized vehicles, used to indicate to the drivers that temporary stopping is prohibited in this area.
The zebra markings in the picture mean the vehicles should go along the indicated lines and may roll on or cross over the markings.

The special lanes in the yellow broken lines in the picture are exclusively for the use of certain types of vehicles and other types of vehicles may use them for overtaking or running a long distance.
The road marking in the picture is a special space for taxicabs to take and drop passengers and other vehicles may use it for temporary stopping.
The road markings in the picture are speed limit markings, used to limit the maximum or minimum speeds of the vehicles.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for ________.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is _______
question.B: An auxiliary signal for going straight

question.Q: The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is ______.
question.B: An auxiliary signal for turning right
question.C: A signal for turning left gently

question.Q: The hand signal of the police in the picture is ______.
question.B: An auxiliary signal for turning left
question.D: A signal for turning left sharply

question.Q: The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is ________.
question.A: A signal for waiting to turn left
question.C: An auxiliary signal for turning left sharply
question.D: A signal for turning left sharply

question.Q: The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is ________.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is _______.
question.A: A signal for pulling to the left

question.Q: The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is ______.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is ______.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is _______.
question.B: A signal for the front vehicle to yield to the back car

question.Q: The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is _______.
question.B: A signal for a rule-breaking vehicle to pull over

question.Q: The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for going straight.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for turning left.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is an auxiliary signal for going straight.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is an auxiliary signal for turning left.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for turning Right.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for turning left sharply.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for stopping.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for the front vehicle to yield to the back vehicle.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for turning Right.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for the front vehicle to yield to the back vehicle.
The hand signal of the traffic police in the picture is a signal for a rule-breaking vehicle to pull over.
